summary: Apple Inc. designs, manufactures, and markets smartphones, personal computers, tablets, wearables, and accessories worldwide. The company offers iPhone, a line of smartphones; Mac, a line of personal computers; iPad, a line of multi-purpose tablets; and wearables, home, and accessories comprising Ai. Apple's strong brand and innovative products have driven its market value to $3.2 trillion.

Alphabet Inc. offers various products and platforms in the United States, Europe, the Middle East, Africa, the Asia-Pacific, Canada, and Latin America. It operates through Google Services, Google Cloud, and Other Bets segments. Alphabet's strong advertising business and growing cloud computing segment have driven its market value to $2.2 trillion.

Microsoft Corporation develops and supports software, services, devices, and solutions worldwide. The company offers office, exchange, SharePoint, Microsoft Teams, office 365 Security and Compliance, Microsoft viva, and Microsoft 365 copilot; and office consumer services. Microsoft's strong cloud computing business and growing productivity software segment have driven its market value to $2.1 trillion.

Meta Platforms, Inc. engages in the development of products that enable people to connect and share with friends and family through mobile devices, personal computers, virtual reality and mixed reality headsets, augmented reality, and wearables worldwide. Meta's strong social media platforms and growing e-commerce segment have driven its market value to $550 billion.

Tesla, Inc. designs, develops, manufactures, leases, and sells electric vehicles, and energy generation and storage systems in the United States, China, and internationally. Tesla's strong electric vehicle sales and growing energy storage segment have driven its market value to $1.1 trillion.

NVIDIA Corporation, a computing infrastructure company, provides graphics and compute and networking solutions in the United States, Singapore, Taiwan, China, Hong Kong, and internationally. NVIDIA's strong graphics processing unit (GPU) business and growing artificial intelligence (AI) segment have driven its market value to $500 billion.

Amazon.com, Inc. engages in the retail sale of consumer products, advertising, and subscriptions service through online and physical stores in North America and internationally. Amazon's strong e-commerce business and growing cloud computing segment have driven its market value to $1.2 trillion.

Netflix, Inc. provides entertainment services. The company offers television (TV) series, documentaries, feature films, and games across various genres and languages. Netflix's strong subscription-based model and growing content library have driven its market value to $550 billion.
